title: Show 'Model Name' in all booking modals and booking UI

requirements.text: Update the booking UI so that the device model is consistently presented as “Model Name” in all booking-related screens and dialogs (customer booking form, public bookings details dialog, and admin bookings details dialog), ensuring the existing `deviceModel` value is what is displayed.

quotes: BOOKING MAI MODAL NAME ADD KARO SAB

acceptanceCriteria: On the Booking page form (`frontend/src/pages/BookingPage.tsx`), the field label “Device Model” is changed to “Model Name” (and any related helper/validation text uses “Model Name”), while still saving into the existing `deviceModel` field.

In the Public Bookings booking details dialog (`frontend/src/pages/PublicBookingsPage.tsx`), the device section label “Device Model” is changed to “Model Name” and the displayed value remains `booking.deviceModel`.

In the Admin Bookings booking details dialog (`frontend/src/pages/AdminBookingsPage.tsx`), the device section label “Device Model” is changed to “Model Name” and the displayed value remains `selectedBooking.deviceModel`.
No backend schema/types are changed; existing bookings continue to load and display the model name correctly from `deviceModel`.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor in `backend/main.mo`; only introduce a migration if strictly required (not expected for this change).
nonGoals: Adding a new backend field separate from `deviceModel` (e.g., a second 'modelName' property).
Changing booking status logic, permissions, or booking list functionality.
